The soil is filled with the footprints of the past.
An ancient Turkic warrior kneels on one knee, gazing toward the sky. Behind him, a banner waves, bearing a single symbol: Billions. In those days, there were swords and armor but the most valuable thing of all was trust. Because victories won on the battlefield were not achieved by strength alone, but by knowing who had your back. From those days on, Billions was like a banner: a value people gathered around, a cause worth standing up for.
Time flowed, eras changed.
Swords gave way to rifles, armor to uniforms. In the early 1900s, a soldier stood guard among the ruins, standing tall beneath the same banner. The world was complex, fronts were uncertain but Billions was still there. Because in the midst of chaos, people were searching for the same thing once again: stability and trust. Billions was not just a name; it was a compass for those who refused to lose their way in difficult times.

And today‚Ä¶
Battlefields are no longer just land. They are digital realms chains, networks, and systems. In a future lit by neon lights, a modern warrior stands among screens. His weapon is technology, his armor is knowledge. On the glowing panels around him, the same name appears: Billions Network. Because even though the era changes and threats evolve, the essence remains the same. Amid false promises, shortcuts to wealth, and unreliable structures, people still need protection.

Billions Network was a banner in the past; today, it is a network.
But the value it carries has never changed.

At Billions, success is not measured only by numbers.
The real gain is trust.
The true strength is continuity.
The real difference is being able to stand strong yesterday and today alike.

That is why Billions Network is more than a project.
It is a legacy stretching from the past to the present‚Ä¶
A fortress to take refuge in during hard times‚Ä¶
And a solid foundation for those who do not want to lose their way in the future.
Because history has shown us this time and again:
Where there is trust, there is Billions.
And where there is Billions, there is a future.
@billions_ntwk @Billions_TR @jgonzalezferrer

Billions [@billions_ntwk] supports "Double Anonymity" which is important in high stake privacy scenarios; like adult content or healthcare. 

This anonymity ensures that the Issuer of a credential does not know where the user presents said credential, as well; the Verifier does not know who issued this credential (only that it is from a trusted list).

Double Anonymity effectively prevents correlation attacks where an Issuer and a Verifier can collude to de-anonymize a user; thereby ensuring total privacy for sensitive interactions.

What building a project really means, and why so many projects die after TGE.‚ÅâÔ∏è

for me, building a project isn‚Äôt just about launching a token or creating hype before tge. 
üëâreal building starts after tge that‚Äôs where most projects fail. 
once the token is out, attention drops, rewards shrink, and people leave. if there‚Äôs no real product or value, the project slowly dies.
@KaitoAI is a perfect example. even if i don‚Äôt explain everything, we are all witnesses to kaito‚Äôs success. it didn‚Äôt die after tge. instead, more people joined after tge, discovered it later, and it genuinely changed their lives through infofi, reputation, and consistency. that‚Äôs what real building looks like.
building means:
users keep coming even without hype the product keeps improving
the community grows stronger over time
people find real value, not just rewards
this is exactly how i see @billions_ntwk. from my experience, they don‚Äôt rush things. they focus on foundation, trust, and longterm vision. what they are building feels real, not forced. every time you think you‚Äôve seen it all, they surprise you again. and honestly, i still believe we haven‚Äôt seen anything yet.
after tge, @billions_ntwk will surprise web3 just like kaito did, but in their own way. not everyone understands it now, and that‚Äôs normal real builders are often quiet at the start.
i also trust no one will build an infofi platform like kaito again. that era belongs to kaito. zero-knowledge, privacy, and trust belong to @billions_ntwk. üíØ they are building something different.
billions network is about:
üëâzero-knowledge privacy
üëâverified ai with accountability
üëâtrust as infrastructure
üëâcommunity before noise
this is why i stay, even without instant wins or hype. real projects don‚Äôt scream, they grow.

The prevalence of bots is currently undermining onchain games,making it difficult to foster genuine communities.

 Solutions like @billions_ntwk's ZK-based verification, which uses NFC scanning to prove humanity without compromising privacy, offer a promising fix. Pair this with @arbitrum's high speed and low-cost infrastructure for NFTs and rewards, and you have a powerful foundation.

 The final hurdle is seamless integration between identity and liquidity layers. Once that bridge is built, onchain games can evolve from demos into thriving, sustainable economies.

let‚Äôs talk about what billions is really building

it its core, billions is building a trust layer for the internet - one that works for both humans and ai agents.

It‚Äôs mobile first, privacy preserving nd designed so you can prove what matters -
without exposing who you are.

not another profile
not another kyc flow
something deeper and more fundamental

think about this for a second -

you open an app
an ai agent gives you advice, moves funds or makes a decision on your behalf.

u don‚Äôt want its source code
u don‚Äôt want marketing promises 

You just want to know -
‚ñ´Ô∏è is this AI real?
‚ñ´Ô∏è who‚Äôs responsible for it?
‚ñ´Ô∏è can it be trusted for this action?

that‚Äôs exactly the gap billions is designed to fill.

here‚Äôs why this actually matters 

as ai moves into finance, healthcare, governance and daily apps, 
trust can‚Äôt be social or assumed anymore

Billions enables :
‚Äì proof without exposure
‚Äì accountability without surveillance
‚Äì trust without central control

humans stay private
ai agents stay accountable

zooming out a bit 
billions is building toward:
‚ñ´Ô∏è a clear boundary between humans and AI
‚ñ´Ô∏è a shared reputation layer for both
‚ñ´Ô∏è a global trust economy where access and value are earned, not guessed

this isn‚Äôt loud tech.
it‚Äôs the kind of infrastructure you don‚Äôt notice at first -
until everything starts depending on it.

Hey, everyone, I just noticed an update on Kaito's @billions_ntwk Leaderboard! 
Today, Kaito introduced new reputation thresholds for all project leaderboards (including our favorite, Billions). 
Because of this, some of the top creators who were previously on the main Creator Leaderboard have moved to the Wider Community Leaderboard. 
But the @billions_ntwk team immediately came out with an important statement:
DON'T PANIC if you've dropped out of the main table!
You are still fully eligible for rewards.
When distributing rewards, they will combine both leaderboards ‚Äî Creator + Wider Community. 
No losses, everything will be taken into account!
 This is done to cut out spam and bots, give newcomers a chance, and make the system even fairer. 
I like this approach ‚Äî the project cares about the community and transparency.

Why @billions_ntwk is Built as Public Infrastructure

Proving you're a real person shouldn't be controlled by one company or locked behind some proprietary system.

It should be something we all share open for anyone to use and build on top of. Any app, protocol, or network should be able to tap into it without needing permission or paying tolls to a gatekeeper.

That's the whole point of Billions. We're not building another walled garden. We're building something that belongs to everyone public infrastructure for the internet.

gBillions

‚Ä¢ no history you can check
